choices.A: Change the auto recovery to disabled, and enable auto recovery.
choices.B: Change the auto recovery timer to active if not already set, then re-establish the connectivity.
choices.C: Change the auto timer to a higher value, then connect the peer switch.
choices.D: Change the role priority, then connect the peer switch.

discussion.content:
That is corect because:

 vPC Master Sticky Bit value is set to FALSE in these scenarios:

When a vPC-enabled switch is rebooted (Note: Sticky Bit is set to FALSE by default).
When vPC role priority is changed or re-entered.

Selected Answer: D
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/switches/nexus-9000-series-switches/218333-understand-and-configure-nexus-9000-vpc.html#anc24
Section: Best Practices during vPC switch Replacement, Point L.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. During a maintenance window of the Nexus switch pair, one of the Cisco Nexus chassis was brought offline for maintenance. The primary Cisco Nexus switch was stable during the maintenance window. After finishing the tasks on the chassis, the administrator wanted to bring the second switch online. The administrator checked the status of the disconnected switch that was removed from the vPC during the maintenance. The engineer must connect the peer chassis seamlessly with the primary vPC peer without experiencing traffic interruption. Which action accomplishes this goal?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
It's seems option A

choices.A: Configure neighbor 192.168.0.7 as an L2VPN EVPN route-reflector client.
choices.B: Activate the IPv4 unicast address family for neighbor 192.168.0.7.
choices.D: Advertise L2VPN EVPN under the IPv4 unicast address family.
choices.C: Enable the send extended community option for the L2VPN EVPN address family.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer configures EVPN on Switch-1. but the neighbors fail to exchange EVPN routes. Which action resolves the issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Add the event-default

choices.A: Include a show ip route CLI action statement.
choices.D: Create a command alias for show ip route.
choices.B: Add the event-default action statement to the end of the script.
choices.C: Modify the event-default action statement to match a syslog pattern.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. The EEM applet generates an SNMP string every time a user executes the show ip route command. After the applet was deployed, other engineers reported that they can no longer use the show ip route command to view the routing information. Which action resolves the issue?

//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A network engineer must display the status of the vPC domain using the Python script and guest shell. The status of Cisco Nexus switches 1 and 2 must be displayed, but the code fails and displays the status of Cisco Nexus switches 0 and 1 instead. Which code resolves the issue?

discussion.content:
for i in range(1,3):
 print('Hello world', i, '\n')

Hello world 1 

Hello world 2

choices.A: print ('Show VPC On Switch', [i] + 1, '\n') on line 5
choices.D: for i in range(1-2): on line 4
choices.C: for i in range(1,3): on line 4
choices.B: print ('Show VPC On Switch', i + 2, '\n') on line 5
